tr.td: HL7 V2
HL7 FHIR
Comments
Name
Definition
DataType
Mapping Rules
Name
Definition
Data Type
Mapping Rules
ARV-01.00.00 - Set ID
SI
N/A
ARV-02.00.00 - Access Restriction Action Code
CNE
TBD
Likely need to use Provenance
ARV-02.01.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
ARV-02.02.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
ARV-02.03.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ID
ARV-02.04.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Alternate Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
ARV-02.05.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Alternate Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
ARV-02.06.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Name of Alternate Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ID
ARV-02.07.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Coding System Version ID

This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.
ST
ARV-02.08.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6. Analogous To CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
ARV-02.09.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Original Text

The text as seen and/or selected by the user who entered the data. Original text can be used in a structured user interface to capture what the user saw as a representation of the code on the data input screen, or in a situation where the user dictates or directly enters text, it is the text entered or uttered by the user. In a situation where the code is assigned sometime after the text was entered, original text is the text or phrase used as the basis for assigning the code.
ST
ARV-02.10.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Second Alternate Identifier
A sequence of characters that uniquely identifies a second alternate code. Analogous to CWE.1- Identifier.
ST
ARV-02.11.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Second Alternate Text
The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to CWE.2 - Text. See usage note in section introduction.
ST
ARV-02.12.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Name of Second Alternate Coding System
Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to CWE.3 Name of Coding System. See usage note in section introduction.
ID

As of v2.7 this component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.20 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated. Receivers should not identify a code based on its position within the tuples (Identifier, Alternate Identifier, or Second Alternate Identifier) or position within a repeating field. Instead, the receiver should always examine the coding System as specified in CWE.12 and/or CWE.20, the "Coding System" component or the "Coding System OID", for the tuple.
ARV-02.13.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 10-12. Analogous to CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
ARV-02.14.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.3. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
ST
This component is required when CWE.1 is populated and CWE.3 is not populated. Both CWE.3 and CWE.14 may be populated.
ARV-02.15.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
ST

A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ARV-02.16.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Value Set Version ID
This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.15. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
DTM
Value set version ID is required if CWE.15 is populated.
ARV-02.17.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Alternate Coding System OID
This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.6. Analogous to CWE.14 Coding System OID.
ST

The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.4 is populated and CWE.6 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated.
ARV-02.18.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.4 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
ST

A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ARV-02.19.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Alternate Value Set Version ID
This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.18. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
DTM
Value set version ID is required if CWE.18 is populated.
ARV-02.20.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Second Alternate Coding System OID
This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.12. Analogous to CWE.14 - Coding System OID.
ST

The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.12 is not populated. Both CWE.12 and CWE.20 may be populated.
ARV-02.21.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Second Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.10 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
ST

A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ARV-02.22.00 - Access Restriction Action Code : Second Alternate Value Set Version ID
This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.21. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
DTM
Value set version ID is required if CWE.21 is populated.
ARV-03.00.00 - Access Restriction Value

This field specifies the information to which access to sensitive information is restricted by applicable jurisdictional, organizational, patient privacy policy or law. This field is used to identify overarching context, for example specific policy defined data elements or message groups (when applicable to ALL groups in the message. For example, under a specific minor’s right to consent for healthcare law coded in ARV-3, all of the minor’s demographic data coded in ARV-4 is sensitive, which may be conveyed in several segments (PID, PD1, PD2)). To a specific element, access may be restricted at the field level by employing the specific HL7 field location in ARV-9. For example, when only some of the demographic data is considered sensitive under a particular minor’s consent coded in ARV-3. Refer to User-defined Table 0717 – Access Restriction Value in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for suggested values.
CWE

Security policies may have very specific, idiosyncratic rules. Such rules would determine the fields and resources carrying restricted information throughout the message. Thus, the receiving application should use policy information to determine which other segments are restricted, and to map the appropriate ARV-4, ARV-5, ARV-7, and ARV-8 fields to those restricted segments
Bundle.meta.security should be high water mark computed in FHIR after ARV-3 and ARV-9 have determined all appropriate resources for labels
ARV-03.01.00 - Access Restriction Value : Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Differ-ent coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
Resource.meta.security.code

Where Resource is based on ARV-09. and the actual resource for the message it applies to. If ARV-09 does not specify a specific segment to associate with, then it must be associated with all resources created as part of this message transformation.

td.p: ARV-3 carries policy that directs placement of the policy code on other resources (ie policy influences X resource) and other security labels on resources (ie, policy requires Y security on X resource).
Move to MSH: MSH-26 contains the high watermark for classification across all ARVs.

This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. ST
Resource.meta.security.version
Resource.meta.security.version must populate to first instance of Bundle.meta.security transformed from v2 to FHIR

ARV-03.14.00 - Access Restriction Value : Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.3. Resource.meta.security.system
This would be a lookup against https://www.hl7.org/fhir/identifier-registry.html; if found, this would replace value in ARV-3.03; if not, use ARV-3.03 as default
This component is required when CWE.1 is populated and CWE.3 is not populated. Both CWE.3 and CWE.14 may be populated.

Who is using this?

Potential extension for "rendered text"?? This could be for the Meta data type or an extension that can be applied to all resources for "security narrative". Or would this just be a set of rules about how receiving systems need to "apply" the codes sent in the FHIR resource(s)

ARV-04.18.00 - Access Restriction Reason : Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.4 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
ST

A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ARV-04.19.00 - Access Restriction Reason : Alternate Value Set Version ID
This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.18. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
DTM
NA
Value set version ID is required if CWE.18 is populated.
ARV-04.20.00 - Access Restriction Reason : Second Alternate Coding System OID
This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.12. Analogous to CWE.14 - Coding System OID.
ST
Resource.meta.security.system
This would be a lookup against https://www.hl7.org/fhir/identifier-registry.html; if found, this would replace value in ARV-3.12; if not, use ARV-3.12 as default

The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
This component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.12 is not populated. Both CWE.12 and CWE.20 may be populated.
ARV-04.21.00 - Access Restriction Reason : Second Alternate Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.10 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
ST

A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ARV-04.22.00 - Access Restriction Reason : Second Alternate Value Set Version ID
This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.21. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
DTM
NA
Value set version ID is required if CWE.21 is populated.
ARV-05.00.00 - Special Access Restriction Instructions
ST
Resource.meta.security.display

td.p: Is there a more visable place for this human readable content?
Could be an extension (see previous comment on a security narrative)
This is more geared to being human readable.

tr.td: ARV-06.00.00 - Access Restriction Date Range
DR
NA

td.p: This is something that should be developed in FHIR

tr.td: ARV-06.01.00 - Access Restriction Date Range : Range Start Date/Time
DTM
ARV-06.02.00 - Access Restriction Date Range : Range End Date/Time
DTM
ARV-07.00.00 - Security Classification Tag

This field defines the security classification (as defined by ISO/IEC 2382-8:1998(E/F)/ T-REC-X.812-1995) of an IT resource, in this case the message, which may be used to make access control decisions. Use of this field supports the business requirement for increasing or decreasing the level of confidentiality (classification or declassification) for a given message.
CWE
ARV-07.01.00 - Security Classification Tag : Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
Resource.meta.security.code
This is the "kitchen sink" problem of putting multiple concepts in meta.security (this needs a larger solution)
ARV-07.02.00 - Security Classification Tag : Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
Resource.meta.security.display
ARV-07.03.00 - Security Classification Tag : Name of Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ID
Resource.meta.security.system
ARV-07.04.00 - Security Classification Tag : Alternate Identifier
Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.
ST
Resource.meta.security.code
Each alternate identifier, text, and system name will be a separate instance of Bundle.meta.security
ARV-07.05.00 - Security Classification Tag : Alternate Text
Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).
ST
Resource.meta.security.display
Each alternate identifier, text, and system name will be a separate instance of Bundle.meta.security
ARV-07.06.00 - Security Classification Tag : Name of Alternate Coding System

Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.
ID
Resource.meta.security.system
Each alternate identifier, text, and system name will be a separate instance of Bundle.meta.security
ARV-07.07.00 - Security Classification Tag : Coding System Version ID

This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.
ST
Resource.meta.security.version
Bundle.meta.security.version must populate to first instance of Bundle.meta.security transformed from v2 to FHIR
ARV-07.08.00 - Security Classification Tag : Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6. Analogous To CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
Resource.meta.security.version
Bundle.meta.security.version must populate to first alternative instance of Bundle.meta.security transformed from v2 to FHIR
ARV-07.09.00 - Security Classification Tag : Original Text

The text as seen and/or selected by the user who entered the data. Original text can be used in a structured user interface to capture what the user saw as a representation of the code on the data input screen, or in a situation where the user dictates or directly enters text, it is the text entered or uttered by the user. In a situation where the code is assigned sometime after the text was entered, original text is the text or phrase used as the basis for assigning the code.
ST
ARV-07.10.00 - Security Classification Tag : Second Alternate Identifier
A sequence of characters that uniquely identifies a second alternate code. Analogous to CWE.1- Identifier.
ST
Resource.meta.security.value
ARV-07.11.00 - Security Classification Tag : Second Alternate Text
The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to CWE.2 - Text. See usage note in section introduction.
ST
Resource.meta.security.display
ARV-07.12.00 - Security Classification Tag : Name of Second Alternate Coding System
Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to CWE.3 Name of Coding System. See usage note in section introduction.
ID
Resource.meta.security.system

As of v2.7 this component is required when CWE.10 is populated and CWE.20 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated. Receivers should not identify a code based on its position within the tuples (Identifier, Alternate Identifier, or Second Alternate Identifier) or position within a repeating field. Instead, the receiver should always examine the coding System as specified in CWE.12 and/or CWE.20, the "Coding System" component or the "Coding System OID", for the tuple.
ARV-07.13.00 - Security Classification Tag : Second Alternate Coding System Version ID
This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 10-12. Analogous to CWE.7 - Coding System Version ID.
ST
Resource.meta.security.version
ARV-07.14.00 - Security Classification Tag : Coding System OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.3. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined code systems the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
ST
Resource.meta.security.system
This would be a lookup against https://www.hl7.org/fhir/identifier-registry.html; if found, this would replace value in ARV-3.03; if not, use ARV-3.03 as default
This component is required when CWE.1 is populated and CWE.3 is not populated. Both CWE.3 and CWE.14 may be populated.
ARV-07.15.00 - Security Classification Tag : Value Set OID

This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) to allow identification of the value set from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. The value for this component is 2.16.840.1.113883.12.#### where "####" is to be replaced by the HL7 table number in the case of an HL7 defined or user defined table. For externally defined value sets, the OID registered in the HL7 OID registry SHALL be used.
ST

A value set may or need not be present irrespective of other fields. Note that if a code is provided, the meaning of the code must come from the definition of the code in the code system. The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ARV-07.16.00 - Security Classification Tag : Value Set Version ID
This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.15. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
DTM
NA
Value set version ID is required if CWE.15 is populated.
ARV-07.17.00 - Security Classification Tag : Alternate Coding System OID
This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.6. Analogous to CWE.14 Coding System OID.
ST
Resource.meta.security.system
This would be a lookup against https://www.hl7.org/fhir/identifier-registry.html; if found, this would replace value in ARV-3.06; if not, use ARV-3.06 as default

This component is required when CWE.4 is populated and CWE.6 is not populated. Both CWE.6 and CWE.17 may be populated.

The meaning of the code SHALL NOT depend on the value set. Applications SHALL NOT be required to interpret the code in light of the valueSet, and they SHALL NOT reject an instance because of the presence or absence of any or a particular value set/ value set version ID.
ARV-07.19.00 - Security Classification Tag : Alternate Value Set Version ID
This component carries the version for the value set identified by CWE.18. The version is a date. The date is the date/time that the value set being used was published.
DTM
NA
Value set version ID is required if CWE.18 is populated.
ARV-07.20.00 - Security Classification Tag : Second Alternate Coding System OID
This component contains the ISO Object Identifier (OID) for the coding system or value set named in CWE.12. Analogous to CWE.14 - Coding System OID.
ST

This would be a lookup against https://www.hl7.org/fhir/identifier-registry.html; if found, this would replace value in ARV-3.12; if not, use ARV-3.12 as default

DTM

ARV-09.00.00 - Access Restriction Message Location

This field is optional and repeating and identifies the location in a message related to the identified access restricted data. If multiple repetitions are present, the listed access restrictions apply to all listed places.
CWE
Each of these attributes provides information for an integration engine to place the preceeding security tags on the appropriate FHIR resource instances
ARV-09.01.00 - Access Restriction Message Location : Segment ID
Specifies the 3-letter name for the segment.
ST
ARV-09.02.00 - Access Restriction Message Location : Segment Sequence
Identifies the segment occurrence within the message.
NM
ARV-09.03.00 - Access Restriction Message Location : Field Position
Identifies the number of the field within the segment. The first field is assigned a number of 1. Field number should not be specified when referring to the entire segment.
NM
ARV-09.04.00 - Access Restriction Message Location : Field Repetition

Identifies the repetition number of the field. The first repetition is counted as 1. If a Field Position is specified, but Field Repetition is not, Field Repetition should be assumed to be 1. If Field Position is not specified, Field Repetition should not be specified.
NM
ARV-09.05.00 - Access Restriction Message Location : Component Number
Identifies the number of the component within the field. The first component is assigned a number of 1. Component number should not be specified when referring to the entire field.
NM
ARV-09.06.00 - Access Restriction Message Location : Sub-Component Number

Identifies the number of the sub-component within the component. The first sub-component is assigned a number of 1. Sub-component number should not be specified when referring to the entire component.
NM
ARV-10.00.00 - Access Restriction Instance Identifier

This field carries the unique identifier for this access restriction and is conditionally required when ARV-2 is NOT valued ‘S’ to support the use of action code for tracking changes when using dynamic mode. This instance identifier is persistent between messages. Implementation guides may restrict what mode to use, which will affect the effective optionality of this field.
EI
Each of these attributes provides information for an integration engine to place the preceeding security tags on the appropriate FHIR resource instances
ARV-10.01.00 - Access Restriction Instance Identifier : Entity Identifier

The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4.
ST
Resource.meta.tag.value
ARV-10.02.00 - Access Restriction Instance Identifier : Namespace ID

<universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).
IS
Resource.meta.tag.system
ARV-10.03.00 - Access Restriction Instance Identifier : Universal ID

<universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).
ST
Resource.meta.tag.value
ARV-10.04.00 - Access Restriction Instance Identifier : Universal ID Type

The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.
ID
Resource.meta.tag.system
